title: Angel Figueroa (boxer)
text:
Angel Luis Figueroa Otero (29 August 1929 – 20 May 1953) was a Puerto Rican <a href="boxing">boxer</a>. He competed in the <a href="Boxing%20at%20the%201952%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Bantamweight">men's bantamweight</a> event at the <a href="1952%20Summer%20Olympics">1952 Summer Olympics</a>. A year later, he died fighting for the United States in the <a href="Korean%20War">Korean War</a>.
1952 Summer Olympics.
Figueroa fought in the men's bantamweight event at the 1952 Summer Olympics representing <a href="Puerto%20Rico">Puerto Rico</a>. He defeated <a href="Ti%E1%BA%BFn%20V%C3%ACnh">Tiến Vình</a>, representing <a href="Vietnam">Vietnam</a>, on points in his opening bout. He was eliminated in his next fight - on points - by František Majdloch, of <a href="Czechoslovakia">Czechoslovakia</a>.
Personal life.
Figueroa served as a <a href="Private%20%28rank%29">private</a> in the <a href="223rd%20Infantry%20Regiment%20%28United%20States%29">223rd Infantry Regiment</a>, <a href="United%20States%20Army">United States Army</a> during the <a href="Korean%20War">Korean War</a>. He was <a href="killed%20in%20action">killed in action</a> at <a href="Punchbowl%2C%20Korea">the Punchbowl</a> on 20 May 1953. He was buried at the <a href="Puerto%20Rico%20National%20Cemetery">Puerto Rico National Cemetery</a> in <a href="Bayam%C3%B3n%2C%20Puerto%20Rico">Bayamón, Puerto Rico</a>.
